costumeCategories1.name: Traditional Spanish Flamenco Dress
costumeCategories1.description: A vibrant and flowing dress worn during Flamenco dance performances.

costumeCategories1.name: Matador Suit
costumeCategories1.description: The iconic suit worn by matadors during bullfighting events.

costumeCategories2.name: Traditional Portuguese Folk Costume
costumeCategories2.description: Colorful and intricately designed traditional costume worn during cultural events.

costumeCategories2.name: Fado Singer Attire
costumeCategories2.description: Clothing worn by Fado singers, reflecting the rich musical tradition of Portugal.

costumeCategories3.name: Chedda tetouania
costumeCategories3.description: The Chedda is the traditional bridal attire of Tetouan, with origins dating back to Muslim Andalusia.The bride wears a two-piece caftan and a wide ancient belt called 'Hzam Sqalli,' imported from Fes and named after the Sqalli family who perpetuated this tradition. On top, she wears a white 'Errda' (Berber izar) adorned with golden stripes or lace.

costumeCategories3.name: Traditional Moroccan Djellaba
costumeCategories3.description: A long, loose-fitting outer robe with a hood, commonly worn in Morocco.

costumeCategories3.name: Berber Tribal Attire
costumeCategories3.description: Traditional clothing worn by the Berber people, showcasing intricate patterns and vibrant colors.

costumeCategories3.name: Daraa sahara
costumeCategories3.description: The 'Daraa' is a loose-fitting garment adorned with a few colorful motifs and has two wide openings on each side. It is available in two colors: blue or white. Sahrawi men wear the 'Daraa' in their daily lives as well as during celebrations and special occasions. It is typically worn with a shirt and loose-fitting pants.
